files.README.md:
# spark-explore

A Claude Code plugin that adds a deep codebase exploration agent powered by [Codex Spark](https://openai.com/codex) (`gpt-5.3-codex-spark`) via MCP.

## What it does

Adds a `spark-explore:spark` agent that complements Claude Code's built-in Explore agent:

| | Built-in Explore | spark-explore:spark |
|---|---|---|
| Model | Haiku (local) | Codex Spark (via MCP) |
| Best for | Quick lookups — grep, find file, read snippet | Deep analysis — architecture, multi-file reasoning, "how does X work" |
| Speed | Fast for small queries | 1000+ tokens/sec for large analysis |

Claude routes between them automatically based on the task.

## Install

```
/plugin marketplace add KennyKeni/spark-explore
/plugin install spark-explore
/spark-explore:setup
```

Restart Claude Code after setup to load the MCP server.

## Uninstall

```
/spark-explore:uninstall
/plugin uninstall spark-explore
```

## Requirements

- [Codex CLI](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@openai/codex): `npm install -g @openai/codex`
- Auth: `codex login`
- ChatGPT Pro subscription (Spark is Pro-only during research preview)

## How it works

1. Setup registers Codex CLI as an MCP server via `claude mcp add`
2. The plugin provides an agent (`spark`) that delegates to Codex Spark via MCP
3. Claude routes deep exploration questions to it based on the agent's description
4. Simple lookups still go to the built-in Explore agent

No code — the entire plugin is config and prompts. Codex CLI's native `mcp-server` subcommand does the heavy lifting.

## License

MIT
